definitions.definition: A pigmented filament of keratin which grows from a follicle on the skin of humans and other mammals.
The collection or mass of such growths growing from the skin of humans and animals, and forming a covering for a part of the head or for any part or the whole body.
definitions.example: In the western world, women usually have long hair while men usually have short hair.

definitions.definition: A slender outgrowth from the chitinous cuticle of insects, spiders, crustaceans, and other invertebrates. Such hairs are totally unlike those of vertebrates in structure, composition, and mode of growth.
A cellular outgrowth of the epidermis, consisting of one or of several cells, whether pointed, hooked, knobbed, or stellated.
definitions.example: Internal hairs occur in the flower stalk of the yellow frog lily (Nuphar).

definitions.definition: A locking spring or other safety device in the lock of a rifle, etc., capable of being released by a slight pressure on a hair-trigger.
Any very small distance, or degree; a hairbreadth.
definitions.example: Just a little louder pleaseâ€”turn that knob a hair to the right.

definitions.definition: Complexity; difficulty; quality of being hairy
